thread.title: Iron ore rises for first day in seven
thread.title_full: Iron ore rises for first day in seven | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Advertiser

author: Daniel Palmer
title: Iron ore rises for first day in seven
text:
A BETTER-than-expected reading on the Chinese manufacturing sector has been the catalyst for iron oreâ€™s latest losing run to come to an end.
At the end of the latest session, benchmark iron ore for immediate delivery to the port of Tianjin in China was trading at $US54.50 a tonne, up 0.2 per cent from $US54.40 a tonne in the prior session.
The positive session was the commodity's first in seven days amid ongoing concerns about Chinese growth.
Driving the mild rebound was an improved reading on Chinese manufacturing, with Beijing reporting its official PMI had risen to 49.8 in September, ahead of projections and the August mark of 49.7.
The sector still remains in contraction, but investors welcomed signs of stabilisation after a challenging year.
A private survey by Caixin/Markit, which targets small and medium-sized Chinese manufacturers, fell to a fresh six-and-a-half year low of 47.2, but beat an earlier estimate of 47.
 Iron ore rises for first day in seven
